ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 709
ygData.msgSnippet: My main character is on Vallon Zek, a Halfelf Bard named Catnip Silentpaws. I would no way be on a regular server..  its way too boring for my taste. I d
ygData.messageBody:
My main character is on Vallon Zek, a Halfelf Bard named Catnip Silentpaws.
I would no way be on a regular server.. its way too boring for my taste.
I'd rather always be on my toes.. it makes the game more exciting! Sitting
in MM isn't as boring when a group of 20 Darkelves/Trolls/Ogres suddenly
attack! All of your songs suddenly gain seconds uses.. For instance
everyone on this list says how much Mel. Motion is a waste of a songbook
slot.. Its one of my most useful songs and is always memmed. You can't hit
what you can't catch! Well, for those of you who want to spice up your life
a little.. try it out. Thats all! ^_^;;

~Catnip Silentpaws~
Bard of Vallon Zek



----- Original Message -----
From: <eqbards@onelist.com>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, February 02, 2000 7:24 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Digest Number 709

> Message: 1
> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 15:55:53 -0600
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
> Subject: RE: Ok I need advice...
>
> Pick-up groups in Blackburrow Paw or Crushbone suck. They continued to
suck
> in Unrest. Ditto, Cazic. Sol-B. And Lower Guk. People just don't change
> much. You get the kind that is so focused on loot that unless they are
> getting loot - they are sure someone else is stealing it from them. They
> don't trust others because they project their own personality traits. On
> our server, we have recent reports of a guy in lower guk stealing off a
> party member who has died and has given consent to drag. Instead of
getting
> better at high levels - it seems like it gets worse.
>
> In reality, it's just the same idiots but instead of level 5, they are
level
> 50. Do you honestly expect that someone is going to have major
personality
> changes in like 6 to 9 months simply by playing a computer game? Granted
> some do, but for the most part - they don't. Any power they get just
> enhances already ingrained traits. Simply a guild does not cure this
> either. There are plenty of guilds with bickering about loots. But if
you
> are guilded and you are with your guild group, at least you know what to
> expect and you maybe have some standard loot rules.
>
> Sylly Songsynger
> <The Pantheon>
> Bardette of 43 songs
> somewhere on Innoruuk
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, February 01, 2000 12:43 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Ok I need advice...
>
> From: "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...>
>
> Last night.... Got invited to a Plane of Sky trip - my
> first trip to the planes. It was not a guild trip but a bunch of people
> just going.
>
> So my question is this... what do I do? I know in the
> future I'm not looting a thing and that we should have had more clear
rules
> set up. Does this happen on other servers? Has this happened to any of
> you?
>
> Almost as disillusioned as Harmonic,
> Halana
> Sol Ro
>
>
>
>

___

> Message: 2
> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 12:23:30 -1000
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> Subject: Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
> Since DEs have innate ultravision, I was always under the impression that
> when you activated the DE illusion with the Mask of Deception that you
were
> supposed to gain this ability. As a wood elf, I have infravision so can
> normally see fine at night. However, whenever I activate the DE illusion,
> I'm blind as a bat (i.e. I lose infravision and don't gain ultravision).
I
> have had shamans buff me with the Ultravision spell and I have also had
> magicians give me a Coldstone to equip so I know what Ultravision is
> supposed to look like. The difference at night when I have either of
these
> two buffs versus the vision I have with the DE illusion is literally the
> difference between night and day.
>
> So is the Mask of Deception supposed to also give you ultravision? I have
> talked with enchanters who regularly cast the DE illusion spell on
> themselves so they can see at night. Is it possible that this component
of
> the Mask of Deception is broken?
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
>
>
____________________________________________________________________________
___
>
____________________________________________________________________________
___
>

> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 15:26:55 -0700
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> Subject: RE: Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
> The old mask gave UV with the illusion. I'm not sure about the new one.
I
> know a couple of monks who taold me the old one did anyhow.
>
> Kit

> Message: 4
> Date: Thu, 01 Apr 1999 17:54:26 -0500
> From: SteelWolf <steelwolf@...>
> Subject: Re: Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
> The Guise of the Deceiver did and still does give Ultravision. I am not
> sure if the Guise of Deception does or not, I will try and check and get
> back to you if no one posts an answer before then. The ultravision was a
> big reason why everyone wanted a mask, and not just large races for it's
> economy-shirnk effect (DE Form). Humans in particular got a real bonus
> from the Ultravision.
>
> Ariell Thunderwolf, Karana
>
>

> Message: 5
> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 16:46:47 -0600
> From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>
> Subject: RE: Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
> One thing I discovered the other day was that I cast the mask illusion and
> got ultravision, but during the course of a fight I wove in psalm of
warmth
> and when the song ended, poof, there went my ultravision. I just recast
the
> illusion and got the UV back.
>
> Its annoying but it seems to work still, oh but this is with the pre-patch
> mask too so this test doesn't really validate your question...it just
raises
> a possible issue that I have experienced with respect to the affect.
>
> Reminds me of when I used to have a shiny brass shield back in the olden
> days and whenever I entered and exited water I would have to unequip and
> re-equip the shield to get the lightsource effect back. That was a royal
> pain the wazoo when I went to innothule for the first time!
>
> -Faras
>

> Message: 6
> Date: Tue, 01 Feb 2000 14:59:12 PST
> From: "Tom Henschel" <tomhenschel@...>
> Subject: What I do when I get bored of the regular server
>
> Greetings all,
> What I do when I get bored is change to Vallon Zek, a pvp teams server. I
> am experimenting with a few different classes, but I have 2 bards at level
5
> (started half-elf bard in Kelethin <only place to start a half elf bard
> there>). I have 2 bards because I started a half elf bard first on the
first
> week of release and couldn't get any Medium size armour in Kelethin. So
> that bard tweaked (hehe a level 5 tweaking a level 1) my Wood elf bard and
> she leveled up quickly.
>
> The point is if some folks find that they get bored on their regular
server,
> doing the same old same old, then try a pvp server. I have decided to try
> to make an Troll Shadow Knight now. His mission will be to kill casters
> (most casters are Human and Elf based). He will be a sort of anti-PK
pk'er.
> His MO will be to shadow step and hunt down those medding casters :)
>
> Ok, ok....that is just an idea based on frustration, but it does add a
whole
> new dimension to the game. If you have friends or guildmates that you
could
> convince to meet you with you on a pvp server, then you could watch each
> other's backs, and hunt PC's and NPC's alike. And be hunted :)
>
> I am now level 40 on Cazic Thule server, and quite sick of waiting lists
and
> the like. I also have a hard time with the Hill Giants, because I get
them
> fighting and some group or other will move in and kill em off for me
I
> just want a short diversion. Nothing permanent.
>
> Does anyone else have a secondary character on the pvp servers?
>
> Fflewduer Fflamson 40 Cazic-Thule
> Aria 5 Vallon Zek
> Brushof SK lvl 1 Vallon Zek (should he be a REALLY bad Troll and lay
waste
> to medding casters?)
> ______________________________________________________
> Get Your Private, Free Email at http://www.hotmail.com
>
>
>
>

> Message: 8
> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 13:12:48 -1000
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> Subject: Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
> Well this is definately strange because it isn't working for me. I was in
> Ogguk fighting bouncers near the zone when I activated the illusion.
There
> isn't a light source there so it became very dark. When I told my party I
> couldn't see anymore, the shaman buffed me with Ultravision and I could
then
> see very well. The ultravision buff from the shaman gave everything a
> bluish tint to it so thats how I knew that the DE illusion wasn't working.
>
> The end result is that I hardly ever activate the illusion anymore. Only
> reason I do it in Ogguk is so I can sell to the merchant with an amiable
> /con.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
>
> > From: Valharick@...
> >
> > Yep Ive got the new mask and it gives me UV just fine.

> Message: 9
> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 15:08:18 -0800 (PST)
> From: Ronnie Roads <rkroads@...>
> Subject: Splitting Spawns using Lament - Pumice - Resists
>
> We have had some threads regarding Fire Giants and their resistance to
certain
> spells and songs. I cannot remember if we covered all of these questions,
and I
> have missed about a week's worth of posts, so please bear with me.
>
> I split the frenzied room in Lower Guk last night with Lament (to the
amazement of
> some group members, by the way, who said the frenzied _always_ comes - go
bards!!).
> I am level 48 and the frenzied is only about 45 I think. I have pulled
Sol B king
> area; it is no problem with Lament.
>
> I have not tried to split the Lord room in Lower, although it is quite
open and
> would be easy to try. The King room is a different story. Seems you
would have to
> invis into the room to get into a position to even try.
>
> Also, the group of 4 fire giants in Sol B - I know they cannot be
mesmerized. Is
> lament the same spell type and thus also not applicable?
>
> Another question relating to pulling. John, you have used pumice
extensively. What
> is its range? I hear it is quite large. Now that debuffing causes a mob
to aggro,
> could you use the pumice as a ranged weapon with which to pull?
>
> Comments and suggestions about pulling higher level areas are welcome 8).
>
> Finally, I felt sick to my stomach as I saw the second resist messages
flow when I
> tried out Pixie and Lullaby in Lower Guk Frenzied area last night. They
seem
> useless songs now.
>
> file://Maravana Vireo of the Jus Divinum
> file://Level 48 Bard of Mithaniel Marr
>
>
> __________________________________________________
> Do You Yahoo!?
> Talk to your friends online with Yahoo! Messenger.
> http://im.yahoo.com
>
>
>

> From: "Andrew Simpson" <hornsfan@...>
> Subject: Re: Splitting Spawns using Lament - Pumice - Resists
>
> >From: Ronnie Roads <rkroads@...>
>
>
> >I have not tried to split the Lord room in Lower, although it is quite
open
> >and
> >would be easy to try.
>
> This is very doable. I've done it two times now. Put 8 minutes between
each
> pull so that there was a nice spread between fights and we pulled all
night.
> I lost all the lottos though. :)
>
>
>
> >Also, the group of 4 fire giants in Sol B - I know they cannot be
> >mesmerized.
>
> I don't know about Lament and the fire giants (we had a monk pulling for
us
> the 2 times I did this), but Pixie Strike worked on the fire giants. Tenya
> kept one giant out of the fight while we killed Skarlon. I had always
heard
> that mez didn't work on them too until I saw it.
>
> Anthem Dirgemaker
> Level 50 Bard

> Date: Tue, 01 Feb 2000 18:34:20 CST
> From: "Andrew Simpson" <hornsfan@...>
> Subject: RE: Ok I need advice...
>
> Woo finally the politics of my server makes the list!! (Comments below)
>
> >From: "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...>
> >
> > So my question is this... what do I do? I know in the
> >future I'm not looting a thing and that we should have had more clear

>
>
> Since Martyr decided to steal the Dawnfire off Cazic Thule's corpse this
has
> been a big issue on our server.
>
> It happened again in Fear the other night when one ranger looted some
ranger
> greaves even though he lost the lotto.
>
> Because of these two incidents, those who would normally be completely
> rational go a little overboard when someone doesn't do something as quick
as
> they expected it. Its truly sad that these two individuals have made it
very
> difficult to go on any planes run unless you join a power guild because of
> loot stealing issues and its made people who are normally very nice into
> people who trust no one and are looking for conspiracy at every turn.
>
> I'm assuming that most decided that this theft never actually occurred
> though because its not plastered all over the solusekro.org message boards
> so I think you are in the clear.
>

> Message: 13
> Date: Tue, 1 Feb 2000 16:05:49 -1000
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> Subject: Mask of Deception and Ultravision
>
> I posted earlier that I wasn't gaining ultravision when I activated the DE
> illusion from the Mask of Deception. Someone followed up that the
> ultravision from the Mask worked fine for them. Would like to hear from
> other people who have a Mask of Deception to see if they get ultravision
> when activating the illusion. Specifically need to know what race you
are.
> Its possible that the ultravision works for humans (who only have normal
> vision) but may possibly be broken for wood elves and/or half-elves (who
> have infravision). BTW my bard is a wood elf.
>
> This request doesn't apply to people who have the Guise of the Deceiver.
>
> Thanks
> Galtin of E'ci
>
>
